message:
I recommend using await or IProgress<t> for UI updates, and not calling Invoke directly.

Async/await (with Task.Run) allows you to push the CPU-bound work off the UI thread (Task.Run), and allows the UI code to treat the offloaded CPU-bound work as though it were asynchronous (async/await).

Have you looked at my posts comparing Task.Run to BackgroundWorker? They are a series of examples that show how to do the same thing in both systems, and explains why (IMO) Task.Run is better: [https://blog.stephencleary.com/2013/05/taskrun-vs-backgroundworker-intro.html](https://blog.stephencleary.com/2013/05/taskrun-vs-backgroundworker-intro.html)
